doc:
Sebastian Cabot (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebastian_Cabot_(actor) 0 Charles Sebastian Thomas Cabot (6 July 1918 – 22 August 1977) was an English film and television actor, best remembered as the gentleman's gentleman, Giles French, opposite Brian Keith's character, William "Uncle Bill" Davis, in the CBS-TV sitcom Family Affair (1966–1971). He was also known for playing the Wazir in the film Kismet (1955) and Dr. Carl Hyatt in the CBS-TV series Checkmate (1960–1962). Cabot was also a voice performer in many Disney animated films; he made his first contribution through The Sword in the Stone (1963) as both the narrator and Sir Ector. Not long thereafter, he brought life to Bagheera in The Jungle Book (1967). His longest-standing role came through the Winnie the Pooh series, in which he narrated Winnie the Pooh and the Honey Tree (1966), Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day (1968), Winnie the Pooh and Tigger Too (1974), and The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh (1977). Charles_Sebastian_Thomas_Cabot ( 6_July_1918 – 22_August_1977 ) was an_English_film_and_television_actor , best remembered as the_gentleman 's_gentleman , Giles_French , opposite_Brian_Keith 's_character , William " Uncle_Bill_"_Davis , in the_CBS-TV_sitcom_Family_Affair ( 1966 – 1971 ) . He was_also_known for playing the_Wazir in the_film Kismet_(_1955_) and Dr._Carl_Hyatt in the_CBS-TV_series_Checkmate_(_1960 – 1962_) . Cabot was also a_voice_performer in many_Disney_animated_films ; he made his_first_contribution through The_Sword in the_Stone ( 1963_) as both the_narrator and Sir_Ector . Not_long thereafter , he brought life to Bagheera in The_Jungle_Book ( 1967_) . His_longest-standing_role came through the_Winnie the_Pooh_series , in which he narrated Winnie the_Pooh and the_Honey_Tree_(_1966_) , Winnie the_Pooh and the_Blustery_Day_(_1968_) , Winnie the_Pooh_and_Tigger_Too_(_1974_) , and The_Many_Adventures of Winnie the_Pooh_(_1977_) .
